articles.author: Brad Brooks, Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali, Dietrich Knauth
articles.description: Several U.S. cities braced for protests against President Donald Trump's sweeping immigration raids, as parts of the country's second largest city Los Angeles spent the night under curfew in an effort to quell five days of unrest.
articles.title: US cities brace for more protests as parts of Los Angeles placed under curfew

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli military strikes killed at least 35 Palestinians in the Gaza Strip on Wednesday, most of them at an aid site operated by the U.S-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation in central Gaza, local health officials said.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 35 in Gaza, many near an aid site, medics say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Elon Musk said he regretted some of the posts he made last week about President Donald Trump as they had gone "too far".
articles.title: Musk says some of his posts about Trump 'went too far'

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: President Donald Trump says he sent in the National Guard and Marines to liberate Los Angeles from the violence of protesters, but some residents of Little Tokyo, a neighborhood hit hardest by the unrest say "no thanks" Mr President.
articles.title: Trump wants to 'liberate' Los Angeles, residents say 'no thanks'

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: Austrian authorities were searching on Wednesday for answers to why a 21-year-old gunman shot dead 10 people in a rampage at his former high school before killing himself, one of the worst outbreaks of violence in the country's modern history.
articles.title: Austrian police search for answers after mass shooting in school

articles.author: Clodagh Kilcoyne
articles.description: Hundreds of masked rioters attacked police and set homes and cars on fire in the Northern Irish town of Ballymena, in the second successive night of disorder that followed a protest over an alleged sexual assault in the town.
articles.title: Northern Irish rioters attack police, torch houses for second night

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: Months after orchestrating a conservative takeover of the Kennedy Center's leadership, President Donald Trump will attend "Les Miserables" on Wednesday, his first show at the performing arts facility that has become a symbol of U.S. cultural and political divides.
articles.title: Trump to attend 'Les Miserables' at revamped Kennedy Center, where sales have fallen

articles.author: Vitalii Hnidyi
articles.description: A nine-minute-long Russian drone attack on Ukraine's second largest city of Kharkiv in the middle of the night killed at least two people and injured 54, including five children, regional officials said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Intense Russian drone attack on Kharkiv kills 2, injures 54, Ukraine says

articles.author: Timour Azhari
articles.description: Peace between Syria and Israel is "very possible", a Trump-linked evangelical Christian pastor said after he and a pro-Israel American rabbi held talks this week with Syria's Islamist leader Ahmed al-Sharaa at the presidential palace in Damascus.
articles.title: Pro-Israel rabbi and Trump-linked pastor visit Syria, say peace is possible

articles.author: Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israel's parliament is set to hold a preliminary vote to dissolve itself following a dispute over conscription, a first step that could lead to an early election, which polls show Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu would lose.
articles.title: Israel Knesset set to vote on disbanding in first step to possible election
